io.atomix.storage.buffer

Class HeapBytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.storage.buffer.AbstractBytes
      • io.atomix.storage.buffer.ByteBufferBytes
        • io.atomix.storage.buffer.HeapBytes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bytes, BytesInput<Bytes>, BytesOutput<Bytes>, AutoCloseable

    public class HeapBytes
extends ByteBufferBytes
    ByteBuffer based heap bytes.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY

        public static final byte[] EMPTY

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static HeapBytes allocate(int size)
        Allocates a new heap byte array.
        Parameters:
        size - The count of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The heap buffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If count is greater than the maximum allowed count for an array on the Java heap - Integer.MAX_VALUE - 5

      • wrap

        public static HeapBytes wrap(byte[] bytes)
        Wraps the given bytes in a UnsafeHeapBytes object.

        The returned Bytes object will be backed by a HeapMemory instance that wraps the given byte array. The Bytes.size() will be equivalent to the provided by array length.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to wrap.

      • hasArray

        public boolean hasArray()
        Description copied from interface: Bytes
        Returns whether the bytes has an array.
        Returns:
        Whether the bytes has an underlying array.
